messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Kirby, Lord of the Rings, cards, help!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/4/02 4:41:28 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... I dont have Ray, but the other two fellas I have plenty of.. I just started Dean Koontz
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/4/02 4:41:28 PM Eastern Standard Time,
ddzimlew@... writes:

> Deb L, who has Ray Bradbury holding up Dean Koontz and Stephen King

I dont have Ray, but the other two fellas I have plenty of.. I just started
Dean Koontz' Doorway to Heaven ( or something like that).. I recently read
The Green Mile.. I had seen the movie, but hadnt read the book.. Of course
the book was better, but the movie was pretty true to it. I also like James
Patterson.. I want to get Four Blind Mice ASAP.. maybe Santa will help me out
:-)

My boys can't wait for Two Towers.. they are counting down the days.

Teresa


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Kirby, Lord of the Rings, cards, help!
messages.msgSnippet: ***I don t need bookends.  I think bookends are for people who don t have enough books.***  You are SO right! How do you fit books just between those things
messages.messageBody:
***I don't need bookends. I think bookends are for people who don't have
enough
books.***

<G>
You are SO right!
How do you fit books just between those things on a shelf?
What's wrong with one stack holding up the other?

Deb L, who has Ray Bradbury holding up Dean Koontz and Stephen King.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Kirby, Lord of the Rings, cards, help!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/4/02 12:20:20 PM, kellitraas@yahoo.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/4/02 12:20:20 PM, kellitraas@... writes:

<< You mean the four CD set isn't with frills, I thought the extended part
was about as frilly as I could get? Bummer! I havn't even seen the other.
>>

There's one that also includes the national geographic special about New
Zealand as Middle Earth, and two bookends (like the kings on the river), and
if Kirby's correct, a couple or three collectible playing cards which aren't
available elsewhere.

I don't need bookends. I think bookends are for people who don't have enough
books.
And the national geographic special is available from Netflix.
But I didn't know about the cards...

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Kirby, Lord of the Rings, cards, help!
messages.msgSnippet: Sandra, You mean the four CD set isn t with frills,  I thought the extended part was about as frilly as I could get?    Bummer!  I havn t even seen the other.
messages.messageBody:
Sandra,
You mean the four CD set isn't with frills, I thought the extended part was about as frilly as I could get? Bummer! I havn't even seen the other.

As you can tell I got the 4 CD set also.

Sorry, can't help you.

Kelli
SandraDodd@... wrote:If there are families here who purchased or who will receive for Christmas
the boxed set of the extended version of The Fellowship of the Ring (with the
bookends), IF you do not have gaming-children, Kirby begs me to beg you to
let him have the few collectible cards that come with that.

I didn't know about the playing cards when I opted for the four-DVD set
without frills. He's greatly troubled about that, and asked me please to ask
my homeschooling friends who might have just lost the cards, given them to
young children who don't need them, or used them for bookmarks or some such.

We could trade other card-stuff, or negotiate for some compensation to those
who might be willing to part with the cards.

And he wouldn't mind having more than one set if that's a possibility.

He's getting involved in playing that game, his main interest is Faramir, and
apparently the cards in that set are unavailable otherwise.

Thanks!

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Kirby, Lord of the Rings, cards, help!
messages.msgSnippet: wow...wish mine came with cards! I would have been happy to send them on to someone who cared, but no cards in my extended edition:( Beth in Ga ... From:
messages.messageBody:
wow...wish mine came with cards! I would have been happy to send them on to someone who cared, but no cards in my extended edition:(
Beth in Ga
----- Original Message -----
From: SandraDodd@...
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, December 04, 2002 8:51 AM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Kirby, Lord of the Rings, cards, help!


If there are families here who purchased or who will receive for Christmas
the boxed set of the extended version of The Fellowship of the Ring (with the
bookends), IF you do not have gaming-children, Kirby begs me to beg you to
let him have the few collectible cards that come with that.

I didn't know about the playing cards when I opted for the four-DVD set
without frills. He's greatly troubled about that, and asked me please to ask
my homeschooling friends who might have just lost the cards, given them to
young children who don't need them, or used them for bookmarks or some such.

We could trade other card-stuff, or negotiate for some compensation to those
who might be willing to part with the cards.

And he wouldn't mind having more than one set if that's a possibility.

He's getting involved in playing that game, his main interest is Faramir, and
apparently the cards in that set are unavailable otherwise.

Thanks!

Sandra

We could trade other card-stuff, or negotiate for some compensation to those

And he wouldn't mind having more than one set if that's a possibility.

He's getting involved in playing that game, his main interest is Faramir, and
apparently the cards in that set are unavailable otherwise.

Sandra
